alert.note: Alert for Calvert (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 11:44AM EDT until June 05 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Calvert County. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 AM EDT Monday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, water is expected to reach backyards near 9th Street in North Beach, and could approach 9th Street. At 3.0 feet, parking lots near Charles Street in Solomons begin to flood, with several inches of water covering low- lying portions of Charles Street and Williams Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one and a half to two feet above normal. The next high tides at Chesapeake Beach are at 4:58 PM this afternoon and 5:23 AM Monday morning. The next high tides at Solomons Island are at 2:55 PM this afternoon and 3:39 AM overnight. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Chesapeake Bay at North Beach MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.0 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.6 ft, Moderate 2.6 ft, Major 3.6 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/05 PM 2.3 0.9 1.4 0.5 None 05/05 AM 3.5 2.1 1.6 0.5 Minor 05/05 PM 2.2 0.8 1.3 0.5 None 06/06 AM 2.9 1.5 1.0 0.5 None 06/07 PM 2.0 0.6 1.0 0.5 None Patuxent River at Solomons Island MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.0 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/02 PM 2.8 1.3 1.6 1.0 None 05/03 AM 3.4 1.9 1.7 1.0 Minor 05/04 PM 2.6 1.1 1.3 1.0 None 06/04 AM 2.9 1.4 1.1 1.0 None 06/04 PM 2.2 0.7 0.9 1.0 None 07/04 AM 2.4 0.9 0.8 1.0 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
